comments:
I200411160944, Windows XP 
 
I think this has something to do with working sets, but I'm not entirely sure.  
Assigning to Nick as he's made changes to working sets.  CC'ing Tod as he owns 
working sets.

This is apparently just a problem with the test.
The assertion in question is comparing the number of working set descriptors
with the number of entries showing in the new working set wizard's table.

The recent changes to working sets add support for dynamic working sets.
The dialog only contains entries for working sets with their own page.

The test should be changed to consider only editable working set descriptors.
The tests passed after the patches were released, and during the build
submission, because the new dynamic working set extensions from JDT were not
around at the time.
Nick, which tests do I have to run when I work on working sets ?
It's probably easiest to run the whole UI test suite:
org.eclipse.ui.tests.UITestSuite.

It doesn't take that long.  If you want to be more selective, run:

IWorkingSetManagerTest
IWorkingSetTest
UINewWorkingSetWizardAuto
UIEditWorkingSetWizardAuto
The fix for the test failure was released to HEAD yesterday.
As part of this, I added WorkingSetDescriptor.isEditable() and have changed
WorkingSet.isEditable() to call it.


Verified in I20041214-2000.
